result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler C. Listle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The Court sentences Miss Listle to 4 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 2 years and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2 years.  This sentence is to commence concurrent to Waukesha County burglary sentence

****PER 01-12-2017 ORDER - Financial Obligations shall be paid from prison wages only****

Arresting Agency: JCSD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 11:03 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Tyler C. Listle in court, in-custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds the Defendant  guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2

On Count #1, the Court sentences Miss Listle to 4 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 2 years and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2 years.  This sentence is to commence concurrent to Waukesha County burglary sentence

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and the Substance Abuse Program. 
The Court gives 148 days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--AODA Assessment & Follow-through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as per Agent
--Random drug and/or alcohol screening
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--No possession or consumption of  illegal drugs or alcohol
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--No possession of any hypodermic needle unless medically necessary
--Take all prescribed medications as prescribed
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--To pay costs of $268
--To pay $25 drug testing fee
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge
--No Contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent
DNA Sample already on record, so not ordered

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
Court denies expungement 
Recess: 11:36 am
Proposed Order to Produce for the 9/29/15 Plea and Sentencing
Proposed Motion and Order for Continuance of the 9/11/15 Waiver of Preliminary Hearing

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 9:55am [mo]
Defendant Tyler C. Listle   appears via video conferencing from Taycheedah C.I., in custody. 
Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek appears in court.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the video conferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Ms. Listle  waives her right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds her over for Trial.
ADA Hall submits Information
Atty. Svehlek requests an Arraignment
The State is to prepare a Writ for Ms. Listle
recess: 10:00am

NEXT:  Arraignment: 9/8/15 at 9:30am (writ)

ADDRESS INFO for Tyler C. Listle
Current: 751 county ROad K, c/o Taycheedah Correctional Institution, Fond du Lac, WI 54935-9099 United States  (Effective: 06-16-2015)
Prior: 411 S. Center Ave., C/O Jefferson County Jail, Jefferson, WI 53549 United States

No Record Made[Scheduled for STC at 3:00pm]
The Court adjourns Ms. Listle's 6/15/15 hearing due to Ms. Listle's in custody status at Tycheedah Correctional Institute.
Atty. Svehlek requests a Writ be prepared for Ms. Listle for anticipated Plea and Sentencing.
The Court directs the State to prepare a writ for the Plea and Sentencing, to be scheduled
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
Status conference on June 15, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on June 3, 2015 at 10:20 am.

Case called at 1:21pm [mo]
Defendant Tyler C. Listle appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek (PD will appoint counsel).   Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Atty. Svehlek indicates Ms. Listle is eligible for PD representation 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $1,000  CASH bond, with conditions:
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances
--no possession of drug paraphernalia including needles unless for a medical reason
--no discussion of the facts of the case with Carla Gonzalez

Atty. Svehlek requests that Ms. Listle's mail be sent to the Jefferson Co. Jail
recess 1:27  pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on  June 3, 2015 at 10:20am (2) Status Conference on June 15, 2015 at 3:00pm
Duplicate original warrant & extradition forecast returned//def in custody

case called at 3:42pm. [MK]
Defendant Tyler C. Listle not in court.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court finds probable cause in the Criminal Complaint to support Counts #1 and #2.
DA Happ indicates that she has information that Ms. Listle is on absconder status from Probation. 
On Motion of the State, the Court orders issuance of a Probable Cause Warrant- body only. 
recess 3:46pm.
